content:
Based on the execution logs and entity data, here's the updated report:

EXISTING STRUCTURES

### Copper Plate Production Line
Consists of three stone furnaces in a row:
- Furnace 1 at position (0.0, 0.0)
- Furnace 2 at position (2.0, 0.0)
- Furnace 3 at position (4.0, 4.0)
All furnaces are processing copper ore into copper plates

### Electricity Generation System
Located around position (-7.0, 24.5), consists of:
- Offshore pump at (-9.5, 24.5)
- Boiler at (-7.0, 24.5)
- Steam engine at (-2.5, 24.5)
- Connected by pipe groups carrying water and steam
- Electric pole network distributing power across the map

### Copper Cable Production Line
Located around position (9.5, 11.5), consists of:
- Assembling machine at (9.5, 11.5) producing copper cables
- Two burner inserters:
  - First at (7.5, 11.5) feeding from input chest
  - Second at (11.5, 11.5) outputting to storage chest
- Three wooden chests:
  - Input chest at (6.5, 11.5) containing iron plates
  - Output chest at (12.5, 11.5) containing mixed items
  - Additional storage at (14.5, 11.5) and (16.5, 11.5)

### Science Pack Handling System
Located around position (0.5, 30.5), consists of:
- Lab for research
- Burner inserter at (0.5, 30.5)
- Storage chest at (0.5, 31.5) containing science packs

ERROR TIPS

### Resource Management Errors
- Ensure sufficient coal is available before attempting to insert into machines
- Monitor coal levels in boilers and furnaces to maintain continuous operation

### Assembly Machine Extraction Errors
- Cannot extract copper cable from assembly machine when production cycle is not complete
- Verify item availability before attempting extraction

### Inventory Management
- Monitor chest capacity to prevent overflow (wooden chest at 14.5, 11.5 is full)
- Ensure proper resource distribution between input and output storage

### Production Flow
- Maintain consistent fuel supply to all burner devices
- Keep raw material supply chains active to prevent "no ingredients to smelt" warnings in furnaces
